markdownRemark.html:
If you live in the center of the universe, you probably heard that the New York City MTA has finally unveiled support for contactless payments.

[HOOK INTO POST]

  • recent experience with faulty metrocard
  • swipe issues (hillary getting stuck)

“See Agent”

  • recent experience with faulty metrocard
  • “See Agent” after swiping multiple times
  • Had just loaded $40 the day before
  • No agent, of course
  • Forced to purchase another card
  • Agent at Union Square confirmed issue and given an envelop
  • Given the operating status of the MTA, did not much have faith my card would be returned
  • Pleasantly surprised - card arrived the same day OMNY went live on my route

MetroCard History

  • Magnetic stripe card
  • The card was introduced in 1992 to enhance the technology of the transit system and eliminate the burden of carrying and collecting tokens.
  • MTA tokens discontinued on May 3, 2003
  • Current swipe is expected to be phased out by 2023 as OMNY is rolled out across the system

OMNY Rollout

  • https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/OMNY
  • http://web.mta.info/mta/news/books/pdf/1905201400CPOC.pdf

OMNY Risks

  • System

    • Variance in performance of contactless cards
    • Potential software/hardware anomalies
    • Network comms
    • Volume stress test

  • Customer experience

    • Market penetration of contactless cards
    • Changing customer habits and expectations
    • New transit transaction model (TTM)
    • Open payment transactions are sometimes slower. There is a risk that OMNY transactions may not achieve the required throughput at high volume stations
    • There are many contactless bank card manufacturing and personalization facilities worldwide, and performance of all cards has not been the same. Therefore, some bank cards many not be accepted due to system design variables or other reasons.
    • OMNY is an account based system, and customers will no longer see confirmation of fares charged at the point of entry.

UX Pros/Cons

  • Any impact on
  • What will happen to status/vanity cards (see: SUPREME)
  • Interesting that customers will have to depend on both

frontmatter.title: 20 Years of Product Management in 25 Minutes
